content.description: Stand start with hands in the crack that forms the X. Move up and left to the shelf, then continue up the crack on the left side rocking a layback. Find the topout jug and mantle through. So good!
content.location: Bottom of the obvoius X on the steep face of the boulder.

climbs.name: X Gonna Give It to Ya!

content.description:
This thing! Stand start on the bottom of the same crack as "X Marks the Spotter." Head up to the horizontal and then start working out right towards the tallest part of the boulder. Find a high foot and mantle up until you find the "thank god" dish to pull through. MEGA CLASSIC!!!

 *Note: the top of this boulder can be wet. Better to go scope it out first.
content.location: Find the X feature on the boulder. This line follows the right arm of the X.

content.description: Potential project for an ambitious crusher. Start low on the arete at the right side of the main face. Move up/left to a decent crimp rail. Cross into a bad pinch, then blast up to the good rail (crux). Top out per "X Gonna Give It To Ya!"

Crazy hard first move! Start on the left side of the main face on the thinnest crimps of a tiny horizontal crack. Throw up right to crimp/sidepull at the next crack, then work up through the mantle topout.
Will someone please come put this down? Start low on the downhill side of the main face. Pull some hard moves and try not to back-dab in the block behind you. Take it straight up the bulge.
content.location: Downhill side of the main face between Boulder X and the smaller block below.

content.description: Unassuming from the trail, the back side of this block hosts several proud lines and is defined by two cracks that form an X.
